intro: Globularia trichosantha subsp. longisepala, commonly known as the long-sepaled globularia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and is native to the Canary Islands. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to rocky or coastal environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
